message: The Trafficking Victims Protection Act was intended to combat human trafficking, an issue that is “one of the least understood phenomenons” and yields $150 billion for human traffickers every year, according to Heritage’s Olivia Enos, a policy analyst in the Asian Studies Center who specializes in human rights and transnational criminal issues.

data.description: Experts discuss the next steps in combating global human trafficking.
data.title: Here Are the Next Steps in Fighting ‘Modern Day Slavery’
